intro: Coilonox barbatum, commonly known as the hairy beardplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a hairy, upright stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Coilonox barbatum is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
